meanings.definition: A group of people of noble or high social rank
meanings.sent1: The patriciate in the kingdom held great power and influence.
meanings.sent2: She was born into the patriciate and lived a life of luxury.
meanings.sent3: The patriciate threw a grand ball in their elegant mansion.
meanings.sent4: His manners were so refined, he seemed to embody the essence of the patriciate.
meanings.sent5: The patriciate's extravagant lifestyle was the envy of all.

meanings.definition: The status or position of being a member of the patrician class
meanings.sent1: Achieving patriciate was a lifelong dream for many in the town.
meanings.sent2: She proudly displayed her patriciate through her elegant attire.
meanings.sent3: The patriciate of the town was evident in their exclusive club meetings.
meanings.sent4: He wore his patriciate like a badge of honor, never forgetting his roots.
meanings.sent5: The patriciate's influence extended far beyond their social circle.

meanings.definition: To be characteristic of or associated with the patrician class
meanings.sent1: The grand estate patriciated wealth and sophistication.
meanings.sent2: Her elegant manners patriciate her noble upbringing.
meanings.sent3: The luxurious ballroom patriciates the opulence of the patrician lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: His refined taste patriciates his belonging to the upper class.
meanings.sent5: The extravagant decorations patriciate the grandeur of the event.
